content.description: The axis of Earth in relation to the Sun is tilted at a 23.5 degree slant, as illustrated in the diagram below. Use the diagram below to answer the next three questions.
content.question: Which of the following areas receives the most intense solar radiation at the time of year shown in the diagram, and why?

choices.label: The Antarctic Circle, because it is closest to the Sun.
The Tropic of Capricorn, because this latitude is nearly horizontal to incoming solar radiation.
The equator, because it is the hottest region and therefore receives the most intense solar radiation.
The Tropic of Cancer, because solar radiation spreads out over a wider area at this latitude.

content.answer: The Tropic of Capricorn, because this latitude is nearly horizontal to incoming solar radiation.
